definition: to stride toward (success)/to march toward/to take a step toward
to take a step/to stride
surname Xiang
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly

sentences.english: The obvious one is the move towards the architecture that are by and large loosely coupled distributed systems.
sentences.chinese: 最明显的一个是迈向架构，是对大松耦合分布式系统。

sentences.english: Failure is an essential step towards success.
sentences.chinese: 失败是迈向成功之路所必不可少的。

sentences.english: Dr. Sun Yat-sen led the Chinese people to a free country.
sentences.chinese: 孙逸仙博士带领中国人民迈向自由。

sentences.english: There are many ways to avoid success in life, but the most sure-fire just might be procrastination.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的人生道路中有许多事情牵拌着我们迈向成功。

sentences.english: We are reaching out for a new and boundless frontier.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在正迈向一个没有边际的新境界。

sentences.english: They have often raise a man from mediocrity to success.
sentences.chinese: 它们常常使一个平庸之辈迈向成功。

sentences.english: In fact, one may pay for frustration on the way to success.
sentences.chinese: 挫折其实就是迈向成功所应缴的学费。

sentences.english: Look at life through the wind-shield.
sentences.chinese: 透过档风玻璃迈向人生。

sentences.english: Your habits alone determine who you become. Your habits alone determine if you succeed.
sentences.chinese: 仅仅你的习惯就能决定你能成为谁，是否迈向成功。

sentences.english: It was, for a brief time, a brisk stroll into the future.
sentences.chinese: 在一个短暂时间内，它是一次迈向未来的轻快漫步。

sentences.english: The march to China's cities is part of a global sea change.
sentences.chinese: 迈向中国城市的行军是全球大变化的一部分。

sentences.english: Yu of the Xia Dynasty exploited the road towards civilization in the Huanghe River Basin.
sentences.chinese: 夏禹的功业，据说开辟了黄河流域迈向文明的道路。

sentences.english: Xing to eat at home, cattle father and mother to encourage them to advance to marriage.
sentences.chinese: 邢致在一一家吃饭，牛父牛母鼓励他俩早点迈向婚姻。

sentences.english: Striver itself more to being a success means a group of people.
sentences.chinese: 奋斗者本身也更多的是指那群正在迈向成功的人。

sentences.english: We should work to maintain a medium-high rate of growth and promote the development of industries toward the medium-high end.
sentences.chinese: 保持经济中高速增长，推动产业迈向中高端水平。

sentences.english: Zhanhaoju is sincerely willing to hand by hand stride with the vast consumers and customers in the new century.
sentences.chinese: 展灏居愿真诚与广大客户及消费者携手迈向新的世纪。

definition: to step in/to stride forward/to forge ahead
to step into/to enter
new level/higher plane
direction/strike (i.e. angle of inclination in geology)/inclination/trend/to move towards/to head for
to step out/to take a (first) step
the road one must follow or take/the only way
to crane one's neck/to await eagerly/to lead/to show the way
new age
to walk into
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
start/beginning
journey/expedition/voyage
broad and open road (idiom); fig. brilliant future prospects
(aerospace) to boost/booster (rocket)/(behavioral economics) to nudge
fast lane
a helping hand/help/assistance
